intro: Alafia major, commonly known as the giant alafia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are elongated and often have a velvety texture, while its flowers come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. Alafia major is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
